member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Matrix3x2
member.summary: A 3x2 matrix, used for 2D transforms. To manipulate matrix values, use the System.Numerics type instead.

remarks.p: This Windows Runtime type is only used for data exchange, and does not include any methods for manipulating the values or performing math computations. For more complete functionality, use the namespace instead.

System.Numerics.Matrix3x2 provides implicit conversion operators to and from Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Matrix3x2, so you can use System.Numerics types in your application code, then pass these values directly to Windows Runtime APIs that consume the Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics types.

member.summary: Value at row 1 column 1 of the matrix.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Plane
member.summary: A plane. To manipulate plane values, use the System.Numerics type instead.

remarks.p: This Windows Runtime type is only used for data exchange, and does not include any methods for manipulating the values or performing math computations. For more complete functionality, use the namespace instead.

System.Numerics.Plane provides implicit conversion operators to and from Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Plane, so you can use System.Numerics types in your application code, then pass these values directly to Windows Runtime APIs that consume the Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Plane.Normal
member.summary: Normal vector of the plane.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Plane.D
member.summary: Distance of the plane along its normal from the origin.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Quaternion
member.summary: A four dimensional vector, used to represent a rotation. To manipulate quaternion values, use the System.Numerics type instead.

remarks.p: This Windows Runtime type is only used for data exchange, and does not include any methods for manipulating the values or performing math computations. For more complete functionality, use the namespace instead.

System.Numerics.Quaternion provides implicit conversion operators to and from Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Quaternion, so you can use System.Numerics types in your application code, then pass these values directly to Windows Runtime APIs that consume the Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Quaternion.W
member.summary: Rotation component of the quaternion.
